title: Attempting to copy circular storage type to memory crashes Truffle compile
body:
## Issue

Truffle will crash when attempting to compile a contract that contains an attempt to copy a value of a circular type from storage to memory.  This appears to be a problem with Truffle, not `solc`.  For instance, I tried direct compilation with `solcjs` and got no compile error; and the crash message certainly seems to show a crash in Truffle, not `solc`.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Truffle project with the following contract:

```
contract CopyTest {

  struct Tree {
    Tree[] children;
  }

  Tree storageTree;

  function run() public {
    Tree memory memoryTree;
    memoryTree = storageTree;
  }

}
```

2. Run `truffle compile`.

## Expected Behavior

The project compiles without error.

## Environment

* Operating System: Linux Mint 18.3 64-bit
* Ethereum client: N/A
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.0.2
* node version (`node --version`): 10.6.0
* npm version (`npm --version`): 6.6.0

I'm suffering from the same issue. 

Truffle v4.1.15 (core: 4.1.15)
Solidity v0.4.25 (solc-js)
node:  v11.9.0
npm: v6.5.0

It works fine when I call them with `node --stack-size=1200` option
```bash
node --stack-size=1200 ./node_modules/.bin/truffle compile
```

And for the Travis-CI setting, I'm now using the following setting for this problem 
```yaml
before_install:
  - cp "$(which node)" "$(which node)_bin"
  - echo '#!/bin/bash' > $(which node)
  - echo "$(which node)_bin --stack-size=1200 \$@" >> $(which node)
```

My hypothesis is that solcjs is doing something non-optimal and running it inside `truffle compile` is already too deep into the stack. Not sure next steps, maybe we can reduce the initial stack depth when we invoke solc?

Tying it myself, I was not able to reproduce @wanseob's workaround.  Increasing the maximum stack depth to 1200 did not resolve the error; indeed, there is no maximum stack size I tried that worked.  At 8179 or lower, I got a stack overflow like the one I originally reported; but at 8180 or higher, I got a segfault.  My suspicion is that this really is infinite, and not simply large but finite, so the particular value of the maximum stack size is not the problem.

OK, despite what I said above, on trying it again this does appear to crash `solcjs` after all (thanks to @CruzMolina for pointing this out).  So I guess this is actually a Solidity bug rather than a Truffle bug.  I'm going to close this for now; meanwhile I've filed [an issue](https://github.com/ethereum/solidity/issues/6374) with Solidity.
